name: ilk
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
mainly disapproving a particular type: of someone’s ilk The worst of her criticism was reserved for journalists, photographers, and others of their ilk.of that ilk They do not give children chicken nuggets, potato smiley faces, or processed foods of that ilk. of that ilk mainly Scottish English
of that name; usually used when someone's family name has been mentioned: It was young McBride, Brian of that ilk (= Brian McBride).
See more
More examplesFewer examplesI'm not interested in talking about that man and his ilk.Players of Bailey's ilk do not come along very often.Frankly, I'd be happy if customers of that ilk chose to go elsewhere.Halo, Doom, and other games of that ilk sold exceptionally well that year.
